page.title: 09The Parish Church
page.content: The main feature of Crediton is the Parish Church. A{Saxon}church was built in{739}but by the{15th Century it was falling down and had to be replaced by the{gothic-style}church we have now. This also had to be{restored in the{19th Century. Part of the church known as the{Lady {Chapel}was the{boys' grammar school {from 1547 to 1860.}If you visit the church you will see how beautiful it is. You will also see the wonderful {stained-glass windows.}There is also a small{museum}which shows charters and the history of the church. It is said that{Oliver Cromwell attended divine service at the church with{General Fairfax}after receiving their troops in October 1645. A{memorial}to{Sir Redvers buller stands high above the nave altar.
